ygData.subject: Re: EQ'Lizer Article
ygData.msgSnippet: I have to agree with ya in this one. ... ======================================================= This email message is for the sole use of the intended
ygData.messageBody:
I have to agree with ya in this one.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 8:22 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] EQ'Lizer Article
>
>
> From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
>
>
> I am sorry to say but I agree with Verant's decision on this
> point and I
> also submitted feedback on it before it was implemented.
>
> These items are supposed to be somewhat unique. Now that
> doesn't entirely
> work in an online RPG, but Verant's solution is the next best
> thing. Any
> quest or unique item should not be allowed to be possessed in multiple
> quantities by a single player. This way if someone wants to
> camp the BBC
> because they have it and found out how valuable it is, they
> can. But they
> must sell theirs before getting another. It simply removes the
> "profitability" for camping items from some players. I think
> the dwarven
> tunic should be a lore item as well as the dwarven axes. I
> have just come
> from there and people I saw camping these items day after
> day. Now I am in
> the commonlands or North Ro and these same people are selling
> multiples of
> those items. They built and inventory of unique items and
> are now selling
> them. 2 of those people were warriors and not mages, which
> saddens me.
>
> I don't think dual PGTs should be allowed any more than a
> ranger could have
> dual Ebony Blades or dual Oaken Scimitars. I don't
> particularly like the
> whole economy of unique magic weapons and items either.
> Making them lore
> items and ineligble for trading and selling will go along way
> to reducing
> camping and letting people get these items on their own.
>
> The only reason some of these items are so expensive is
> because high level
> people will simply camp these easy to kill NPCs and prevent
> others from
> obtaining them. I watched one group of mages in Crushbone
> who would watch
> for escaping mobs like Crush, the warlord, darish, royal
> guard, etc. and
> would cast invis on it. They either knew where the mobs flee
> to or they
> were using some magic to see invisible. But they would wait
> till the mob
> regenerated more than half its hit points and then kill it.
> They stole
> these kills in the most dishonorable way for pure profit.
>
> Ok, now I am ranting and will get off my soapbox. But I do feel pretty
> strongly about this topic.
>
> Bael
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeff Auman <jeff.auman@...>
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> Date: Thursday, June 10, 1999 8:20 PM
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] EQ'Lizer Article
>
>
> >From: Jeff Auman <jeff.auman@...>
> >
> >> Jim Ramsay wrote:
> >>
> >>
> >> Those of you dreaming
> >> of dual wielding Polished Granite Tomahawks can forget it, they are
> >> pending Lore items now.
> >
> >Sorry, this should read: Those of you who just got two PGT's, you're
> >now screwed. Thanks Verant.
> >
> >
> >
> >--
> >-Jeff Auman
> >auman@...
> >
